### DiffuCoder: Understanding and Improving Masked Diffusion Models for Code Generation


üß† **AI ADVANCEMENT**


The article presents DiffuCoder, a study focused on enhancing masked diffusion models for code generation tasks. Masked diffusion models have shown promise in generating high-quality code by iteratively refining code snippets. DiffuCoder aims to further advance this technology through a thorough analysis of existing models and the development of new methodologies that address their limitations. The authors propose improvements that enhance the model's capacity to handle complex programming tasks more effectively, boosting both accuracy and efficiency. Their research contributes to the growing field of automated code

It argues that reliance on summary statistics like accuracy or F1 score, while convenient, fails to capture granular insights necessary for effective model evaluation and improvement. The piece advocates for a more detailed analysis that considers various dimensions, such as subgroup performances and error distributions, to better understand model behavior and ensure fairness, robustness, and generalizability across diverse scenarios. ### AIs are Getting Better at Finding and Exploiting Internet Vulnerabilities


üß† **AI ADVANCEMENT**


In recent developments, artificial intelligence systems have shown significant advancements in identifying and exploiting internet vulnerabilities. These AIs, leveraging machine learning and data analysis capabilities, are increasingly adept at discovering flaws and weaknesses in digital infrastructures that can be targeted for cyber-attacks. The evolution of these systems raises both opportunities and challenges: on one hand, they can be used to enhance cybersecurity measures by preemptively identifying and fixing vulnerabilities, but on the other hand, they pose a risk if exploited by malicious entities seeking to compromise

### The Next Frontier of Runtime Assembly Attacks: Leveraging LLMs to Generate Phishing JavaScript in Real Time


üìä **TECH INSIGHT**


The article explores the emerging threat of using Large Language Models (LLMs) to generate sophisticated phishing JavaScript in real time, marking a new frontier in runtime assembly attacks. By efficiently leveraging LLMs, cybercriminals can produce highly convincing and dynamic scripts that bypass traditional security measures, leading to an increased risk of successful phishing attacks. The article highlights the rapid adaptability of LLM-generated code, its potential applications in cyber-attacks, and the challenges it poses to cybersecurity experts in developing effective counterme

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/real-time-malicious-javascript-through-llms/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_842)**

### CISA says critical VMware RCE flaw now actively exploited


üìä **TECH INSIGHT**


The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has identified active exploitation of a critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability in VMware's software. This flaw poses significant security risks, allowing attackers to execute arbitrary code on unpatched systems without user interaction. The urgency of the situation has prompted CISA to urge organizations to prioritize upgrading their VMware environments and apply patches immediately to mitigate potential threats. This exploitation highlights the importance of maintaining up-to-date systems to safeguard against evolving cybersecurity risks.

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/cisa-says-critical-vmware-rce-flaw-now-actively-exploited/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_1976)**

### Resurgence of a multi‚Äëstage AiTM phishing and BEC campaign abusing SharePoint


üß† **AI ADVANCEMENT**


The article discusses a resurgence in a sophisticated AiTM (Adversary-in-the-Middle) phishing and Business Email Compromise (BEC) campaign that exploits SharePoint. This multi-stage attack targets business environments by impersonating popular communication platforms to deceive users into divulging sensitive information. The campaign utilizes AiTM techniques to intercept and manipulate ongoing communication threads, thereby gaining unauthorized access to corporate email accounts and sensitive data. By leveraging the credibility of trusted platforms like SharePoint, the attackers enhance their phishing prowess to

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/security/blog/2026/01/21/multistage-aitm-phishing-bec-campaign-abusing-sharepoint/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_7847)**
